title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2302.3 - Staff for title IV

44.5
(b) The program for administering and supervising title IV of the Elementary and

Secondary Education Act is the responsibility within the State Education

Department of the units generally indicated in section
2302.2
of this Part. The
distribution of this responsibility among department units is described in
detail in section
2302.4
of this Part; the purpose
here is to clarify the types of decision authority assigned to different
units. (c) All matters common to
all parts of title IV of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act, such as
distribution criteria, the single application procedure, and this document
receive final approval from the executive deputy commissioner. The executive
deputy commissioner also approves policy and clears expenditures associated
with the portion of part C dealing with strengthening leadership resources of

State educational agencies. (d) Policy approval for all other part C activities, as well as for part B, falls
to the Deputy Commissioner for Elementary, Secondary and Continuing Educaton. He has delegated the expenditure clearance function to his Assistant

Commissioner for Regents Examinations, Scholarships and Evaluation and the
administration-supervision to the Director for ESC General Program Planning for
part C, and the Chief, Bureau of School Libraries, for part B. Notes

2302.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
